frameDefinitions: An Agent who is engaged in an Undertaking accords a Degree of importance to a Consideration that influences the success of an Undertaking.

A Communicator speaks to an Addressee in such a way that the Addressee understands and fully appreciates the truth and/or relevance of the Message.   ' Marred by overblown writing , this first novel by Wilbur Smith 's wife effectively conveys some of South Africa 's problems .
An Agent acts in such a way as to give the incorrect impression to observers that a particular State_of_affairs holds.
A Communicator publically communicates some difficult-to-express Content which they (or a social group of which they are a member) have had for some time.
In this frame an Agent or Cause changes the consistency of a Patient from its Initial_state to a Result.
Through a  Message, a Speaker (sometimes encoded metonymically by a Medium) communicates the relative importance of the state of affairs denoted by the Message.
frameExamples: Our company <t>emphasizes</t> marketing tried and true products and services.INI
Marred by overblown writing , this first novel by Wilbur Smith 's wife effectively <t>conveys</t> some of South Africa 's problems .INI
Jordan <t>feigned</t> a love of jazz music to get her phone number .
Those grievances can be <t>aired</t> during Board meetings. CNI
Donna <t>thinned</t> the soup with chicken broth.
Reid <t>emphasized</t> that he and Dean meet every month.
listRoleDefinitions: An event or state of affairs, an attribute, or an entity whose properties have the potential to influence the success of the <fen>Agent</fen>'s <fen>Undertaking</fen>.
The <fen>Agent</fen> is the individual who devotes time, concentration, or other resources to a <fen>Consideration</fen> that is important for the success of a larger <fen>Undertaking</fen>.
The <fen>Competing_consideration</fen> is another factor that is relevant to the <fen>Undertaking</fen> to which the <fen>Agent</fen> devotes less attention or effort.
The <fen>Artifact</fen> is a physical object designed with some <fen>Consideration</fen> in mind, such that it functions to facilitate the <fen>Undertaking</fen>.
The <fen>Action</fen> is performed with importance placed on the <fen>Consideration</fen>.
The time period during which the <fen>Agent</fen> attaches a specified degree of importance to the <fen>Consideration</fen> to further the success of the <fen>Undertaking</fen>.
The location in which the <fen>Agent</fen> attaches the specified level of importance  to the <fen>Consideration</fen>.
The person who uses language in the written or spoken modality to convey a <fen>Message</fen> to another person.
The <fen>Addressee</fen> receives a <fen>Message</fen> from the <fen>Communicator</fen>.
<fen>Message</fen> A proposition or set of propositions that the <fen>Communicator</fen> wants the <fen>Addressee</fen> to believe or take for granted.
The physical or abstract setting in which the <fen>Message</fen> is conveyed.
The time at which the communication takes place.
The <fen>Agent</fen> is the person who acts in a misleading way to create the impression that a <fen>State_of_affairs</fen> holds.
This is the entity which is copied. With verbs it is frequently expressed as an NP Object: Pat <t>falsified</t> <fex name='Original'>the papers</fex>.
The Copy produced by the Creator most commonly occurs as the External Argument of a predicative use of an adjective or noun target: <fex name='Copy'>The painting</fex> is a <t>fake</t>.
The <fen>State_of_affairs</fen> is a an event, a state, or a property that the <fen>Agent</fen> wants others to believe have occurred or hold.
The <fen>Time</fen> when the <fen>Agent</fen> feigns something.
The place in which the <fen>Agent</fen> feigns something.
The <fen>Communicator</fen> is the person who expresses the <fen>Content</fen> (whether spoken or written).
The attitude or feeling that the <fen>Communicator</fen> had not previously expressed.
<fen>Medium</fen> is the observable action or product of the <fen>Communicator</fen>.
The time when the <fen>Content</fen> is communicated.
The role specifies the place where the communication takes place.
<fen>Patient</fen> is the entity that undergoes a change.
The <fen>Agent</fen> causes the change of consistency in the <fen>Patient</fen>.
The <fen>Cause</fen> is the non-<fen>Agent</fen> which brings about the change in the <fen>Patient</fen>.
When the <fen>Patient</fen> changes consistency.
Where the the <fen>Patient</fen> changes consistency.
The person who uses language in the written or spoken modality to convey a <fen>Message</fen> to another person.
The proposition whose denotation the Speaker presents as important.
The physical or abstract setting in which the <fen>Message</fen> is conveyed.
The time at which the <fen>Speaker</fen> communicates a <fen>Message</fen>.
The location where the <fen>Speaker</fen> delivers the <fen>Message</fen>.
